page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: On our first walk,between Bramley and Silchester,we saw some men working on a house.The strange thing about it was that the barn/house they were building looked really old but it was brand new The men were putting old fashioned tiles and beams on the house .They even copied the idea of having { {SADDLESTONES},so that when anyone went past it,they thought it was an old house. {In-filling}building is building done on fields or open spaces between existing buildings instead of adding on to edges of a village or town. In {BRAMLEY},at the moment,all the new building is {IN-FILLING.}People have to get planning permission first from the council, but this probably easier to do in Bramley than in somewhere like London which has fewer fields/open spaces available.
